lead_paragraph: DEAN--Anthony A.,died March 7, 2016, surrounded by his family at home in Brooklyn, NY, after a courageous fight with cancer. He was 75. Tony was a philosophy major at Yale College, an editor of the Yale Law Review at Yale Law School, and a Fulbright Scholar at the University of Cologne, Germany. He completed his legal career as a director and of counsel at Gibbons P.C., specializing in antitrust law and corporate and commercial litigation. Previously he was a partner at Windels, Marx, Davies & Ives; at Dunnington, Bartholow & Miller; and an associate at Cravath, Swaine & Moore LLP. He served as a board member and president of the Eastern District Civil Litigation Fund, a nonprofit supporting pro bono counsel in cases before the U.S. District Court for the Eastern District of New York. He also served on boards at Long Island College Hospital and Continuum Health Partners, as president of his co-op, and as a junior warden at Grace Church in Brooklyn Heights. Tony is survived by his wife of 49 years, Joanna; sons Alex and James; four grandchildren; sister Whitney Dean; brother-in-law Andrew Bergman; and his beloved dachshund Phoebe. He was predeceased by his parents, Rebecca and Max, and brother Rick. The family is planning a service. 1/3
